name: places/ChIJVeHWDR1ZwokRr10daahXxVA
formattedAddress: 340 E 46th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 340 E 46th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text:
I lived at the Paper mill lofts for 4 years and paid my rent on time every month (my husband had the bank send the rent check). When we moved out we never told that we would not receive our security deposit. After contacting management, we were told that we did not pay one month’s rent. We were never told which month we did not pay, just that a month’s rent was missing.

Melissa tried to help us as much as she could, but she has no control over the return of the security deposit. I called and emailed Michael numerous times and he never responded. My husband made an  itemized list all of our checks and we sent a copy of EVERY cancelled check proving that we never missed a payment. Again, Michael never responded or acknowledged the receipt of any of the information that we sent him that proved that we never missed a month’s rent.

I filed a lawsuit and no one should up. The judge was very disappointed in how Carlyle handled every step of this process. To no one’s surprise, I won the judgment. I sent all of the paperwork to Michael and no response. I had to get my lawyer involved, and yet Michael has not responded.

My husband and I are seeking further legal recourse regarding this issue but to anyone reading this, you can see how awful this management company is. The local managers and workers are wonderful people, some of the best that I have dealt with. However, as they have no real power, you are left to deal with the management in NYC. Renting with Carlyle is a gamble, unfortunately we lost.

originalText.text:
Don't rent with any of their properties. I lived on the Ambassador  East and I don't know where to start with the negatives.

1. Big issues with roaches
2. Leaks that never got resolved.
3. Hallways constantly dirty and super stinky.
4. Rooftop and Gym remained closed the whole year we were there. We emailed the company about it and they tried to say it was because of COVID even send me a page with the current regulations as proof to what they were saying. The page literally wrote on it that the GYMS are open and should open. Which I pointed out and never got a response.
5. The property manager, (middle aged, blond hair, don't remember the name) such a KAREN. If you call her and try to list the issues with your listing she will interrupt you rudely and ask you to stop talking for no reason. Also she hangs up on people.
6. Doorman take huge bathroom breaks and leave door unattended
7. lost my packages twice

Just stay anywhere else but there. Their prices are also higher than average for no reason.

originalText.text:
***UPDATE: It is now August 7, 2019, and my issue that I brought to Michael's attention on May 4, 2019 is still unresolved. I called the office and was told that he was not in the office, the receptionist was not sure when he would be in, and that she was unable to schedule a phone appointment for me to speak with him. He resurfaced for one day (following the original review), did not resolve or even seem to understand my issue, but did manage to tell me that there were about $300 worth of old utilities bills they "forgot" to charge me that are now due. I still have yet to receive any actual proof of utilities charges or an actual bill. Michael has ignored my emails for 2 weeks since he resurfaced. I have also received additional paper water/sewage bills.

Again, if you want to rent from Carlyle, check all the receipts and documentation and ask for proof of charges because they will not.***

I have lived in their Philly Old City property for almost two years now and have had ongoing problems that management does not properly address.

First, let me say that Melissa on the ground in Philadelphia is wonderful and if I could give her personally 5 stars, I would. But Michael Francisco, Director of Operations, is incredibly frustrating to work with. He ignores emails on a consistent basis and does not solve issues.

MY ADVICE: if you are going to rent from Carlyle, keep a very close eye on your bills. They will send you erroneous bills and will not properly document other charges. Then they will ignore your emails and it will take months to fix things.

Apartment issues so far have included:
- mice;
- water damage on the ceiling and in the bathroom - I first reported the ceiling damage over a year ago, it is still not fixed. I reported the bathroom water damage in April or May and they painted over it but still have not addressed the actual damage.
- Otherwise, the apartment itself has served me well.
.
Management issues:
- I have received 10+ erroneous water/sewage bills in the mail despite my lease stating that I pay a set fee monthly for this; I've never missed a payment. It took multiple emails to Michael Francisco (many of which went fully ignored) for him to address this and I am still receiving erroneous bills in the mail. When he did respond, he had not read my emails fully and he questioned my ability to read whether the bill was for electricity or water/sewage.

- I have never received an actual bill for my utilities charges - just a random charge added spontaneously to my online account. They bill anywhere from 2-8 months late, sometimes adding multiple months at once, so it is impossible to monitor your usage. On May 4, 2019, I asked for a ledger outlining my usage and explaining the charges. I have sent 40+ emails back and forth and Michael ignored the high majority of them. It was not until I reached out to Melissa that my requests were even acknowledged. I am continuously told that I will receive something "today or tomorrow morning." However it has been almost 4 months and I have no explanation or documentation of the veracity of my utilities charges (as of 07/23/2019).

- I am subletting my apartment for the summer. It took weeks for my tenant's application to be reviewed despite ongoing follow-up on my part. They also refused to waive the credit check portion of the application despite the fact that legally my tenant is not financially liable to Carlyle, only me. The owners refused to work with me on that one and then delayed the processing of his application for over a month. Once again, nothing happened until Melissa became involved (again, I would give her five stars if possible).

EDIT (since I cannot reply to the owner's response): I will not be taking additional time to reach out to your general corporate phone number. As stated, I have a 40+ email chain that Michael Francisco has yet to acknowledge or answer. Please feel free to reach out to me directly to resolve the issues. Interesting to see that you respond to Google reviews faster than the Director of Operations responds to emails.

originalText.text: Would give 0 stars if possible, these guys are bad news and have absolutely no respect for their tenants, merely cashing checks on properties they own.  Refuse to fix anything and unresponsive after 16 months of renting from them, will be very happy to never have to interact with them after the lease is over...

Refuse to fix anything and unresponsive after 16 months of renting from them, will be very happy to never have to interact with them after the lease is over...

originalText.text: Their "Ambassador East" appears to have been built in the 1950s and was never renovated. They just lather paint over the walls and cabinets. Dead cockroaches on the floor in the bathroom. Bad location. Ms. Amaya was 25 minutes late to my showing today and didn't even bother apologizing. That set the tone for all the rest. Bad vibes right away. She said "we have a cardio room but as you can imagine it's closed. We have roof, but closed." Well, actually... many buildings have reopened their facilities. It's apparent you are just too lazy of a management company to bother doing it. Don't rent here. This building is an embarrassment at the prices they are asking.
